Rep: Ted Deutch's claim that mass shootings increased by 200 percent in the decade after the assault weapons ban expired in 2004.
At least one researcher found a signific: but experts caution against attributing the increase solely to the ban's expiration.
Former President Bill Clinton made a sim: stating that half of all mass killings in the US occurred after the ban expired in 2005. The claim was awarded Three Pinocchios by The Washington Post Fact Checker.
Gary Kleck: a professor of criminology and criminal justice, argued that the relevant period to compare is the time during the assault weapons ban (1994-2004) and the period after 2004.
